title: Business & Finance
text:
U.S. stocks ended higher despite the GDP data, as the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow notched gains of 1.2%, 1.1% and 1%, respectively.

---

Jack Ma plans to relinquish control of Ant Group, people familiar with the matter said, part of the fintech giant's effort to move away from affiliate Alibaba .

---

Apple reported an almost 11% decline in profit after weathering supply constraints and shutdowns in China, although iPhone sales continued to grow.

---

Amazon posted slowing sales and a net loss for the second straight quarter, as strength in cloud computing was outweighed by weakness in core retail operations.

---

JetBlue agreed to buy Spirit for $3.8 billion, a combination that would create the fifth-largest U.S. airline.

---

Sales from Pfizer 's Covid-19 vaccine and Paxlovid pill gave the company a boost in the second quarter.

---

Altria slashed the value of its investment in Juul Labs by about 70%.

---

Intel reported a surprise quarterly loss of $454 million and cut its full-year outlook.

---

Shell notched a second consecutive record quarterly profit as it benefited from soaring energy prices.
